00041 
00066 int BM_vert_dissolve(BMesh *bm, BMVert *v)
00067 {
00068     const int len = BM_vert_edge_count(v);
00069     
00070     if (len == 1) {
00071         BM_vert_kill(bm, v); /* will kill edges too */
00072         return TRUE;
00073     }
00074     else if (!BM_vert_is_manifold(v)) {
00075         if (!v->e) {
00076             BM_vert_kill(bm, v);
00077             return TRUE;
00078         }
00079         else if (!v->e->l) {
00080             if (len == 2) {
00081                 return (BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, v->e, v, TRUE) != NULL);
00082             }
00083             else {
00084                 /* used to kill the vertex here, but it may be connected to faces.
00085                  * so better do nothing */
00086                 return FALSE;
00087             }
00088         }
00089         else {
00090             return FALSE;
00091         }
00092     }
00093     else if (len == 2 && BM_vert_face_count(v) == 1) {
00094         /* boundary vertex on a face */
00095         return (BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, v->e, v, TRUE) != NULL);
00096     }
00097     else {
00098         return BM_disk_dissolve(bm, v);
00099     }
00100 }
00101 
00105 int BM_disk_dissolve(BMesh *bm, BMVert *v)
00106 {
00107     BMFace *f, *f2;
00108     BMEdge *e, *keepedge = NULL, *baseedge = NULL;
00109     int len = 0;
00110 
00111     if (!BM_vert_is_manifold(v)) {
00112         return FALSE;
00113     }
00114     
00115     if (v->e) {
00116         /* v->e we keep, what else */
00117         e = v->e;
00118         do {
00119             e = bmesh_disk_edge_next(e, v);
00120             if (!(BM_edge_share_face_count(e, v->e))) {
00121                 keepedge = e;
00122                 baseedge = v->e;
00123                 break;
00124             }
00125             len++;
00126         } while (e != v->e);
00127     }
00128     
00129     /* this code for handling 2 and 3-valence verts
00130      * may be totally bad */
00131     if (keepedge == NULL && len == 3) {
00132         /* handle specific case for three-valence.  solve it by
00133          * increasing valence to four.  this may be hackish. .  */
00134         BMLoop *loop = e->l;
00135         if (loop->v == v) loop = loop->next;
00136         if (!BM_face_split(bm, loop->f, v, loop->v, NULL, NULL, FALSE))
00137             return FALSE;
00138 
00139         if (!BM_disk_dissolve(bm, v)) {
00140             return FALSE;
00141         }
00142         return TRUE;
00143     }
00144     else if (keepedge == NULL && len == 2) {
00145         /* collapse the verte */
00146         e = BM_vert_collapse_faces(bm, v->e, v, 1.0, TRUE, TRUE);
00147 
00148         if (!e) {
00149             return FALSE;
00150         }
00151 
00152         /* handle two-valenc */
00153         f = e->l->f;
00154         f2 = e->l->radial_next->f;
00155 
00156         if (f != f2 && !BM_faces_join_pair(bm, f, f2, e, TRUE)) {
00157             return FALSE;
00158         }
00159 
00160         return TRUE;
00161     }
00162 
00163     if (keepedge) {
00164         int done = 0;
00165 
00166         while (!done) {
00167             done = 1;
00168             e = v->e;
00169             do {
00170                 f = NULL;
00171                 len = bmesh_radial_length(e->l);
00172                 if (len == 2 && (e != baseedge) && (e != keepedge)) {
00173                     f = BM_faces_join_pair(bm, e->l->f, e->l->radial_next->f, e, TRUE);
00174                     /* return if couldn't join faces in manifold
00175                      * conditions */
00177                     if (!f) {
00178                         return FALSE;
00179                     }
00180                 }
00181 
00182                 if (f) {
00183                     done = 0;
00184                     break;
00185                 }
00186                 e = bmesh_disk_edge_next(e, v);
00187             } while (e != v->e);
00188         }
00189 
00190         /* collapse the verte */
00191         e = BM_vert_collapse_faces(bm, baseedge, v, 1.0, TRUE, TRUE);
00192 
00193         if (!e) {
00194             return FALSE;
00195         }
00196         
00197         /* get remaining two face */
00198         f = e->l->f;
00199         f2 = e->l->radial_next->f;
00200 
00201         if (f != f2) {
00202             /* join two remaining face */
00203             if (!BM_faces_join_pair(bm, f, f2, e, TRUE)) {
00204                 return FALSE;
00205             }
00206         }
00207     }
00208 
00209     return TRUE;
00210 }
00211 
00227 BMFace *BM_faces_join_pair(BMesh *bm, BMFace *f1, BMFace *f2, BMEdge *e, const short do_del)
00228 {
00229     BMLoop *l1, *l2;
00230     BMEdge *jed = NULL;
00231     BMFace *faces[2] = {f1, f2};
00232     
00233     jed = e;
00234     if (!jed) {
00235         BMLoop *l_first;
00236         /* search for an edge that has both these faces in its radial cycle */
00237         l1 = l_first = BM_FACE_FIRST_LOOP(f1);
00238         do {
00239             if (l1->radial_next->f == f2) {
00240                 jed = l1->e;
00241                 break;
00242             }
00243         } while ((l1 = l1->next) != l_first);
00244     }
00245 
00246     if (UNLIKELY(!jed)) {
00247         BMESH_ASSERT(0);
00248         return NULL;
00249     }
00250     
00251     l1 = jed->l;
00252     
00253     if (UNLIKELY(!l1)) {
00254         BMESH_ASSERT(0);
00255         return NULL;
00256     }
00257     
00258     l2 = l1->radial_next;
00259     if (l1->v == l2->v) {
00260         bmesh_loop_reverse(bm, f2);
00261     }
00262 
00263     f1 = BM_faces_join(bm, faces, 2, do_del);
00264     
00265     return f1;
00266 }

00281 BMEdge *BM_verts_connect(BMesh *bm, BMVert *v1, BMVert *v2, BMFace **r_f)
00282 {
00283     BMIter fiter;
00284     BMIter viter;
00285     BMVert *v_iter;
00286     BMFace *f_iter;
00287 
00288     /* be warned: this can do weird things in some ngon situation, see BM_face_legal_splits */
00289     BM_ITER_ELEM (f_iter, &fiter, v1, BM_FACES_OF_VERT) {
00290         BM_ITER_ELEM (v_iter, &viter, f_iter, BM_FACES_OF_VERT) {
00291             if (v_iter == v2) {
00292                 BMLoop *nl;
00293 
00294                 f_iter = BM_face_split(bm, f_iter, v1, v2, &nl, NULL, FALSE);
00295 
00296                 if (r_f) {
00297                     *r_f = f_iter;
00298                 }
00299                 return nl->e;
00300             }
00301         }
00302     }
00303 
00304     if (r_f) {
00305         *r_f = NULL;
00306     }
00307     return NULL;
00308 }
00309 
00327 BMFace *BM_face_split(BMesh *bm, BMFace *f, BMVert *v1, BMVert *v2, BMLoop **r_l,
00328                       BMEdge *example, const short nodouble)
00329 {
00330     const int has_mdisp = CustomData_has_layer(&bm->ldata, CD_MDISPS);
00331     BMFace *nf, *of;
00332 
00333     BLI_assert(v1 != v2);
00334 
00335     /* do we have a multires layer */
00336     if (has_mdisp) {
00337         of = BM_face_copy(bm, f, FALSE, FALSE);
00338     }
00339     
00340 #ifdef USE_BMESH_HOLES
00341     nf = bmesh_sfme(bm, f, v1, v2, r_l, NULL, example, nodouble);
00342 #else
00343     nf = bmesh_sfme(bm, f, v1, v2, r_l, example, nodouble);
00344 #endif
00345     
00346     if (nf) {
00347         BM_elem_attrs_copy(bm, bm, f, nf);
00348         copy_v3_v3(nf->no, f->no);
00349 
00350         /* handle multires update */
00351         if (has_mdisp && (nf != f)) {
00352             BMLoop *l_iter;
00353             BMLoop *l_first;
00354 
00355             l_iter = l_first = BM_FACE_FIRST_LOOP(f);
00356             do {
00357                 BM_loop_interp_from_face(bm, l_iter, of, FALSE, TRUE);
00358             } while ((l_iter = l_iter->next) != l_first);
00359 
00360             l_iter = l_first = BM_FACE_FIRST_LOOP(nf);
00361             do {
00362                 BM_loop_interp_from_face(bm, l_iter, of, FALSE, TRUE);
00363             } while ((l_iter = l_iter->next) != l_first);
00364 
00365             BM_face_kill(bm, of);
00366 
00367 #if 0
00368             /* BM_face_multires_bounds_smooth doesn't flip displacement correct */
00369             BM_face_multires_bounds_smooth(bm, f);
00370             BM_face_multires_bounds_smooth(bm, nf);
00371 #endif
00372         }
00373     }
00374 
00375     return nf;
00376 }
00377 
00395 BMFace *BM_face_split_n(BMesh *bm, BMFace *f, BMVert *v1, BMVert *v2, float cos[][3], int n,
00396                         BMLoop **r_l, BMEdge *example)
00397 {
00398     BMFace *nf, *of;
00399     BMLoop *l_dummy;
00400     BMEdge *e, *newe;
00401     BMVert *newv;
00402     int i, j;
00403 
00404     BLI_assert(v1 != v2);
00405 
00406     of = BM_face_copy(bm, f, TRUE, TRUE);
00407 
00408     if (!r_l)
00409         r_l = &l_dummy;
00410     
00411 #ifdef USE_BMESH_HOLES
00412     nf = bmesh_sfme(bm, f, v1, v2, r_l, NULL, example, FALSE);
00413 #else
00414     nf = bmesh_sfme(bm, f, v1, v2, r_l, example, FALSE);
00415 #endif
00416     /* bmesh_sfme returns in r_l a Loop for nf going from v1 to v2.
00417      * The radial_next is for f and goes from v2 to v1  */
00418 
00419     if (nf) {
00420         BM_elem_attrs_copy(bm, bm, f, nf);
00421         copy_v3_v3(nf->no, f->no);
00422 
00423         e = (*r_l)->e;
00424         for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00425             newv = bmesh_semv(bm, v2, e, &newe);
00426             BLI_assert(newv != NULL);
00427             /* bmesh_semv returns in newe the edge going from newv to tv */
00428             copy_v3_v3(newv->co, cos[i]);
00429 
00430             /* interpolate the loop data for the loops with v==newv, using orig face */
00431             for (j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
00432                 BMEdge *e_iter = (j == 0) ? e : newe;
00433                 BMLoop *l_iter = e_iter->l;
00434                 do {
00435                     if (l_iter->v == newv) {
00436                         /* this interpolates both loop and vertex data */
00437                         BM_loop_interp_from_face(bm, l_iter, of, TRUE, TRUE);
00438                     }
00439                 } while ((l_iter = l_iter->radial_next) != e_iter->l);
00440             }
00441             e = newe;
00442         }
00443     }
00444 
00445     BM_face_verts_kill(bm, of);
00446 
00447     return nf;
00448 }
00449 
00476 BMEdge *BM_vert_collapse_faces(BMesh *bm, BMEdge *ke, BMVert *kv, float fac,
00477                                const short join_faces, const short kill_degenerate_faces)
00478 {
00479     BMEdge *ne = NULL;
00480     BMVert *tv = bmesh_edge_other_vert_get(ke, kv);
00481 
00482     BMEdge *e2;
00483     BMVert *tv2;
00484 
00485     BMIter iter;
00486     BMLoop *l_iter = NULL, *kvloop = NULL, *tvloop = NULL;
00487 
00488     void *src[2];
00489     float w[2];
00490 
00491     /* Only intended to be called for 2-valence vertices */
00492     BLI_assert(bmesh_disk_count(kv) <= 2);
00493 
00494 
00495     /* first modify the face loop data  */
00496     w[0] = 1.0f - fac;
00497     w[1] = fac;
00498 
00499     if (ke->l) {
00500         l_iter = ke->l;
00501         do {
00502             if (l_iter->v == tv && l_iter->next->v == kv) {
00503                 tvloop = l_iter;
00504                 kvloop = l_iter->next;
00505 
00506                 src[0] = kvloop->head.data;
00507                 src[1] = tvloop->head.data;
00508                 CustomData_bmesh_interp(&bm->ldata, src, w, NULL, 2, kvloop->head.data);
00509             }
00510         } while ((l_iter = l_iter->radial_next) != ke->l);
00511     }
00512 
00513     /* now interpolate the vertex data */
00514     BM_data_interp_from_verts(bm, kv, tv, kv, fac);
00515 
00516     e2 = bmesh_disk_edge_next(ke, kv);
00517     tv2 = BM_edge_other_vert(e2, kv);
00518 
00519     if (join_faces) {
00520         BMFace **faces = NULL;
00521         BMFace *f;
00522         BLI_array_staticdeclare(faces, 8);
00523 
00524         BM_ITER_ELEM (f, &iter, kv, BM_FACES_OF_VERT) {
00525             BLI_array_append(faces, f);
00526         }
00527 
00528         if (BLI_array_count(faces) >= 2) {
00529             BMFace *f2 = BM_faces_join(bm, faces, BLI_array_count(faces), TRUE);
00530             if (f2) {
00531                 BMLoop *nl = NULL;
00532                 if (BM_face_split(bm, f2, tv, tv2, &nl, NULL, FALSE)) {
00533                     ne = nl->e;
00534                 }
00535             }
00536         }
00537 
00538         BLI_array_free(faces);
00539     }
00540     else {
00541         /* single face or no faces */
00542         /* same as BM_vert_collapse_edge() however we already
00543          * have vars to perform this operation so don't call. */
00544         ne = bmesh_jekv(bm, ke, kv, TRUE);
00545         /* ne = BM_edge_exists(tv, tv2); */ /* same as return above */
00546 
00547         if (ne && kill_degenerate_faces) {
00548             BLI_array_declare(bad_faces);
00549             BMFace **bad_faces = NULL;
00550 
00551             BMIter fiter;
00552             BMFace *f;
00553             BMVert *verts[2] = {ne->v1, ne->v2};
00554             int i;
00555 
00556             for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
00557                 /* cant kill data we loop on, build a list and remove those */
00558                 BLI_array_empty(bad_faces);
00559                 BM_ITER_ELEM (f, &fiter, verts[i], BM_FACES_OF_VERT) {
00560                     if (f->len < 3) {
00561                         BLI_array_append(bad_faces, f);
00562                     }
00563                 }
00564                 while ((f = BLI_array_pop(bad_faces))) {
00565                     BM_face_kill(bm, f);
00566                 }
00567             }
00568             BLI_array_free(bad_faces);
00569         }
00570     }
00571 
00572     return ne;
00573 }
00574 
00575 
00583 BMEdge *BM_vert_collapse_edge(BMesh *bm, BMEdge *ke, BMVert *kv,
00584                               const short kill_degenerate_faces)
00585 {
00586     /* nice example implementation but we want loops to have their customdata
00587      * accounted for */
00588 #if 0
00589     BMEdge *ne = NULL;
00590 
00591     /* Collapse between 2 edges */
00592 
00593     /* in this case we want to keep all faces and not join them,
00594      * rather just get rid of the vertex - see bug [#28645] */
00595     BMVert *tv  = bmesh_edge_other_vert_get(ke, kv);
00596     if (tv) {
00597         BMEdge *e2 = bmesh_disk_edge_next(ke, kv);
00598         if (e2) {
00599             BMVert *tv2 = BM_edge_other_vert(e2, kv);
00600             if (tv2) {
00601                 /* only action, other calls here only get the edge to return */
00602                 ne = bmesh_jekv(bm, ke, kv);
00603 
00604                 /* ne = BM_edge_exists(tv, tv2); */ /* same as return above */
00605             }
00606         }
00607     }
00608 
00609     return ne;
00610 #else
00611     /* with these args faces are never joined, same as above
00612      * but account for loop customdata */
00613     return BM_vert_collapse_faces(bm, ke, kv, 1.0f, FALSE, kill_degenerate_faces);
00614 #endif
00615 }

00618 
00630 BMVert *BM_edge_split(BMesh *bm, BMEdge *e, BMVert *v, BMEdge **r_e, float percent)
00631 {
00632     BMVert *nv, *v2;
00633     BMFace **oldfaces = NULL;
00634     BMEdge *e_dummy;
00635     BLI_array_staticdeclare(oldfaces, 32);
00636     SmallHash hash;
00637     const int do_mdisp = (e->l && CustomData_has_layer(&bm->ldata, CD_MDISPS));
00638 
00639     /* we need this for handling multi-res */
00640     if (!r_e) {
00641         r_e = &e_dummy;
00642     }
00643 
00644     /* do we have a multi-res layer */
00645     if (do_mdisp) {
00646         BMLoop *l;
00647         int i;
00648         
00649         l = e->l;
00650         do {
00651             BLI_array_append(oldfaces, l->f);
00652             l = l->radial_next;
00653         } while (l != e->l);
00654         
00655         /* create a hash so we can differentiate oldfaces from new face */
00656         BLI_smallhash_init(&hash);
00657         
00658         for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(oldfaces); i++) {
00659             oldfaces[i] = BM_face_copy(bm, oldfaces[i], TRUE, TRUE);
00660             BLI_smallhash_insert(&hash, (intptr_t)oldfaces[i], NULL);
00661         }
00662     }
00663 
00664     v2 = bmesh_edge_other_vert_get(e, v);
00665     nv = bmesh_semv(bm, v, e, r_e);
00666 
00667     BLI_assert(nv != NULL);
00668 
00669     sub_v3_v3v3(nv->co, v2->co, v->co);
00670     madd_v3_v3v3fl(nv->co, v->co, nv->co, percent);
00671 
00672     if (r_e) {
00673         (*r_e)->head.hflag = e->head.hflag;
00674         BM_elem_attrs_copy(bm, bm, e, *r_e);
00675     }
00676 
00677     /* v->nv->v2 */
00678     BM_data_interp_face_vert_edge(bm, v2, v, nv, e, percent);
00679     BM_data_interp_from_verts(bm, v, v2, nv, percent);
00680 
00681     if (do_mdisp) {
00682         int i, j;
00683 
00684         /* interpolate new/changed loop data from copied old face */
00685         for (j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
00686             for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(oldfaces); i++) {
00687                 BMEdge *e1 = j ? *r_e : e;
00688                 BMLoop *l, *l2;
00689                 
00690                 l = e1->l;
00691 
00692                 if (UNLIKELY(!l)) {
00693                     BMESH_ASSERT(0);
00694                     break;
00695                 }
00696                 
00697                 do {
00698                     if (!BLI_smallhash_haskey(&hash, (intptr_t)l->f)) {
00699                         BMLoop *l2_first;
00700 
00701                         l2 = l2_first = BM_FACE_FIRST_LOOP(l->f);
00702                         do {
00703                             BM_loop_interp_multires(bm, l2, oldfaces[i]);
00704                         } while ((l2 = l2->next) != l2_first);
00705                     }
00706                     l = l->radial_next;
00707                 } while (l != e1->l);
00708             }
00709         }
00710         
00711         /* destroy the old face */
00712         for (i = 0; i < BLI_array_count(oldfaces); i++) {
00713             BM_face_verts_kill(bm, oldfaces[i]);
00714         }
00715         
00716         /* fix boundaries a bit, doesn't work too well quite yet */
00717 #if 0
00718         for (j = 0; j < 2; j++) {
00719             BMEdge *e1 = j ? *r_e : e;
00720             BMLoop *l, *l2;
00721             
00722             l = e1->l;
00723             if (UNLIKELY(!l)) {
00724                 BMESH_ASSERT(0);
00725                 break;
00726             }
00727             
00728             do {
00729                 BM_face_multires_bounds_smooth(bm, l->f);
00730                 l = l->radial_next;
00731             } while (l != e1->l);
00732         }
00733 #endif
00734         
00735         BLI_array_free(oldfaces);
00736         BLI_smallhash_release(&hash);
00737     }
00738 
00739     return nv;
00740 }
00741 
00745 BMVert  *BM_edge_split_n(BMesh *bm, BMEdge *e, int numcuts)
00746 {
00747     int i;
00748     float percent;
00749     BMVert *nv = NULL;
00750     
00751     for (i = 0; i < numcuts; i++) {
00752         percent = 1.0f / (float)(numcuts + 1 - i);
00753         nv = BM_edge_split(bm, e, e->v2, NULL, percent);
00754     }
00755     return nv;
00756 }
00757 
00761 int BM_face_validate(BMFace *face, FILE *err)
00762 {
00763     BMIter iter;
00764     BLI_array_declare(verts);
00765     BMVert **verts = NULL;
00766     BMLoop *l;
00767     int ret = 1, i, j;
00768     
00769     if (face->len == 2) {
00770         fprintf(err, "warning: found two-edged face. face ptr: %p\n", face);
00771         fflush(err);
00772     }
00773 
00774     BLI_array_growitems(verts, face->len);
00775     BM_ITER_ELEM_INDEX (l, &iter, face, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE, i) {
00776         verts[i] = l->v;
00777         if (l->e->v1 == l->e->v2) {
00778             fprintf(err, "Found bmesh edge with identical verts!\n");
00779             fprintf(err, "  edge ptr: %p, vert: %p\n",  l->e, l->e->v1);
00780             fflush(err);
00781             ret = 0;
00782         }
00783     }
00784 
00785     for (i = 0; i < face->len; i++) {
00786         for (j = 0; j < face->len; j++) {
00787             if (j == i) {
00788                 continue;
00789             }
00790 
00791             if (verts[i] == verts[j]) {
00792                 fprintf(err, "Found duplicate verts in bmesh face!\n");
00793                 fprintf(err, "  face ptr: %p, vert: %p\n", face, verts[i]);
00794                 fflush(err);
00795                 ret = 0;
00796             }
00797         }
00798     }
00799     
00800     BLI_array_free(verts);
00801     return ret;
00802 }
00803 
00804 
00819 void BM_edge_calc_rotate(BMEdge *e, int ccw,
00820                          BMLoop **r_l1, BMLoop **r_l2)
00821 {
00822     BMVert *v1, *v2;
00823     BMFace *fa, *fb;
00824 
00825     /* this should have already run */
00826     BLI_assert(BM_edge_rotate_check(e) == TRUE);
00827 
00828     /* we know this will work */
00829     BM_edge_face_pair(e, &fa, &fb);
00830 
00831     /* so we can use ccw variable correctly,
00832      * otherwise we could use the edges verts direct */
00833     BM_edge_ordered_verts(e, &v1, &v2);
00834 
00835     /* we could swap the verts _or_ the faces, swapping faces
00836      * gives more predictable results since that way the next vert
00837      * just stitches from face fa / fb */
00838     if (ccw) {
00839         SWAP(BMFace *, fa, fb);
00840     }
00841 
00842     *r_l1 = BM_face_other_vert_loop(fb, v2, v1);
00843     *r_l2 = BM_face_other_vert_loop(fa, v1, v2);
00844 }
00845 
00852 int BM_edge_rotate_check(BMEdge *e)
00853 {
00854     BMFace *fa, *fb;
00855     if (BM_edge_face_pair(e, &fa, &fb)) {
00856         BMLoop *la, *lb;
00857 
00858         la = BM_face_other_vert_loop(fa, e->v2, e->v1);
00859         lb = BM_face_other_vert_loop(fb, e->v2, e->v1);
00860 
00861         /* check that the next vert in both faces isn't the same
00862          * (ie - the next edge doesn't share the same faces).
00863          * since we can't rotate usefully in this case. */
00864         if (la->v == lb->v) {
00865             return FALSE;
00866         }
00867 
00868         /* mirror of the check above but in the opposite direction */
00869         la = BM_face_other_vert_loop(fa, e->v1, e->v2);
00870         lb = BM_face_other_vert_loop(fb, e->v1, e->v2);
00871 
00872         if (la->v == lb->v) {
00873             return FALSE;
00874         }
00875 
00876         return TRUE;
00877     }
00878     else {
00879         return FALSE;
00880     }
00881 }
00882 
00893 int BM_edge_rotate_check_degenerate(BMEdge *e, BMLoop *l1, BMLoop *l2)
00894 {
00895     /* note: for these vars 'old' just means initial edge state. */
00896 
00897     float ed_dir_old[3]; /* edge vector */
00898     float ed_dir_new[3]; /* edge vector */
00899     float ed_dir_new_flip[3]; /* edge vector */
00900 
00901     float ed_dir_v1_old[3];
00902     float ed_dir_v2_old[3];
00903 
00904     float ed_dir_v1_new[3];
00905     float ed_dir_v2_new[3];
00906 
00907     float cross_old[3];
00908     float cross_new[3];
00909 
00910     /* original verts - these will be in the edge 'e' */
00911     BMVert *v1_old, *v2_old;
00912 
00913     /* verts from the loops passed */
00914 
00915     BMVert *v1, *v2;
00916     /* these are the opposite verts - the verts that _would_ be used if 'ccw' was inverted*/
00917     BMVert *v1_alt, *v2_alt;
00918 
00919     /* this should have already run */
00920     BLI_assert(BM_edge_rotate_check(e) == TRUE);
00921 
00922     BM_edge_ordered_verts(e, &v1_old, &v2_old);
00923 
00924     v1 = l1->v;
00925     v2 = l2->v;
00926 
00927     /* get the next vert along */
00928     v1_alt = BM_face_other_vert_loop(l1->f, v1_old, v1)->v;
00929     v2_alt = BM_face_other_vert_loop(l2->f, v2_old, v2)->v;
00930 
00931     /* normalize all so comparisons are scale independent */
00932 
00933     BLI_assert(BM_edge_exists(v1_old, v1));
00934     BLI_assert(BM_edge_exists(v1, v1_alt));
00935 
00936     BLI_assert(BM_edge_exists(v2_old, v2));
00937     BLI_assert(BM_edge_exists(v2, v2_alt));
00938 
00939     /* old and new edge vecs */
00940     sub_v3_v3v3(ed_dir_old, v1_old->co, v2_old->co);
00941     sub_v3_v3v3(ed_dir_new, v1->co, v2->co);
00942     normalize_v3(ed_dir_old);
00943     normalize_v3(ed_dir_new);
00944 
00945     /* old edge corner vecs */
00946     sub_v3_v3v3(ed_dir_v1_old, v1_old->co, v1->co);
00947     sub_v3_v3v3(ed_dir_v2_old, v2_old->co, v2->co);
00948     normalize_v3(ed_dir_v1_old);
00949     normalize_v3(ed_dir_v2_old);
00950 
00951     /* old edge corner vecs */
00952     sub_v3_v3v3(ed_dir_v1_new, v1->co, v1_alt->co);
00953     sub_v3_v3v3(ed_dir_v2_new, v2->co, v2_alt->co);
00954     normalize_v3(ed_dir_v1_new);
00955     normalize_v3(ed_dir_v2_new);
00956 
00957     /* compare */
00958     cross_v3_v3v3(cross_old, ed_dir_old, ed_dir_v1_old);
00959     cross_v3_v3v3(cross_new, ed_dir_new, ed_dir_v1_new);
00960     if (dot_v3v3(cross_old, cross_new) < 0.0f) { /* does this flip? */
00961         return FALSE;
00962     }
00963     cross_v3_v3v3(cross_old, ed_dir_old, ed_dir_v2_old);
00964     cross_v3_v3v3(cross_new, ed_dir_new, ed_dir_v2_new);
00965     if (dot_v3v3(cross_old, cross_new) < 0.0f) { /* does this flip? */
00966         return FALSE;
00967     }
00968 
00969     negate_v3_v3(ed_dir_new_flip, ed_dir_new);
00970 
00971     /* result is zero area corner */
00972     if ((dot_v3v3(ed_dir_new,      ed_dir_v1_new) > 0.999f) ||
00973         (dot_v3v3(ed_dir_new_flip, ed_dir_v2_new) > 0.999f))
00974     {
00975         return FALSE;
00976     }
00977 
00978     return TRUE;
00979 }
00980 
00981 int BM_edge_rotate_check_beauty(BMEdge *e,
00982                                 BMLoop *l1, BMLoop *l2)
00983 {
00984     /* Stupid check for now:
00985      * Could compare angles of surrounding edges
00986      * before & after, but this is OK.*/
00987     return (len_squared_v3v3(e->v1->co, e->v2->co) >
00988             len_squared_v3v3(l1->v->co, l2->v->co));
00989 }
00990 
01005 BMEdge *BM_edge_rotate(BMesh *bm, BMEdge *e, const short ccw, const short check_flag)
01006 {
01007     BMVert *v1, *v2;
01008     BMLoop *l1, *l2;
01009     BMFace *f;
01010     BMEdge *e_new = NULL;
01011     char f_hflag_prev_1;
01012     char f_hflag_prev_2;
01013 
01014     if (!BM_edge_rotate_check(e)) {
01015         return NULL;
01016     }
01017 
01018     BM_edge_calc_rotate(e, ccw, &l1, &l2);
01019 
01020     /* the loops will be freed so assign verts */
01021     v1 = l1->v;
01022     v2 = l2->v;
01023 
01024     /* --------------------------------------- */
01025     /* Checking Code - make sure we can rotate */
01026 
01027     if (check_flag & BM_EDGEROT_CHECK_BEAUTY) {
01028         if (!BM_edge_rotate_check_beauty(e, l1, l2)) {
01029             return NULL;
01030         }
01031     }
01032 
01033     /* check before applying */
01034     if (check_flag & BM_EDGEROT_CHECK_EXISTS) {
01035         if (BM_edge_exists(v1, v2)) {
01036             return NULL;
01037         }
01038     }
01039 
01040     /* slowest, check last */
01041     if (check_flag & BM_EDGEROT_CHECK_DEGENERATE) {
01042         if (!BM_edge_rotate_check_degenerate(e, l1, l2)) {
01043             return NULL;
01044         }
01045     }
01046     /* Done Checking */
01047     /* ------------- */
01048 
01049 
01050 
01051     /* --------------- */
01052     /* Rotate The Edge */
01053 
01054     /* first create the new edge, this is so we can copy the customdata from the old one
01055      * if splice if disabled, always add in a new edge even if theres one there. */
01056     e_new = BM_edge_create(bm, v1, v2, e, (check_flag & BM_EDGEROT_CHECK_SPLICE)!=0);
01057 
01058     f_hflag_prev_1 = l1->f->head.hflag;
01059     f_hflag_prev_2 = l2->f->head.hflag;
01060 
01061     /* don't delete the edge, manually remove the egde after so we can copy its attributes */
01062     f = BM_faces_join_pair(bm, l1->f, l2->f, NULL, TRUE);
01063 
01064     if (f == NULL) {
01065         return NULL;
01066     }
01067 
01068     /* note, this assumes joining the faces _didnt_ also remove the verts.
01069      * the #BM_edge_rotate_check will ensure this, but its possibly corrupt state or future edits
01070      * break this */
01071     if (!BM_face_split(bm, f, v1, v2, NULL, NULL, TRUE)) {
01072         return NULL;
01073     }
01074     else {
01075         /* we should really be able to know the faces some other way,
01076          * rather then fetching them back from the edge, but this is predictable
01077          * where using the return values from face split isn't. - campbell */
01078         BMFace *fa, *fb;
01079         if (BM_edge_face_pair(e_new, &fa, &fb)) {
01080             fa->head.hflag = f_hflag_prev_1;
01081             fb->head.hflag = f_hflag_prev_2;
01082         }
01083     }
01084 
01085     return e_new;
01086 }
01087 
01091 BMVert *BM_face_vert_separate(BMesh *bm, BMFace *sf, BMVert *sv)
01092 {
01093     return bmesh_urmv(bm, sf, sv);
01094 }
01095 
01101 BMVert *BM_face_loop_separate(BMesh *bm, BMLoop *sl)
01102 {
01103     return bmesh_urmv_loop(bm, sl);
01104 }
